act:
374731 THE HIGH COURTS (SEALS) ACT, 1950
ACT NO. 7 OF 1950 AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE USE OF SEALS OF COMMON FORM AND DESIGN BY THE HIGH [ 27th February, 1950.]
BE it enacted by Parliament as follows:-
1300770 1Short title. This Act may be called the High Courts (Seals) Act, 1950.
469501 2 Seals of High Courts.
621591 1Every High Court in a 1 State] shall have and use, as occasion may arise, a seal bearing a device and impression of the Asoka Capital within an exergue or label surrounding the same, with the following inscriptions at convenient places, namely," THE SEAL OF THE HIGH COURT AT (or OF).................. followed by the name of the seat of the High Court or the name of the State, as the case may be, and" Satyameva Jayate" in Devanagari script.
841576 2Every Court of the Judicial Commissioner for a 2 union territory] shall have and use, as occasion may arise, a seal similar to the seal of a High Court in a 3 State, but with the first inscription reading" THE SEAL OF THE JUDICIAL COMMISSIONER' S COURT FOR.................... followed by the 4 name of the Union territory].
1972545 3The provisions of this Act shall supersede any provision contrary thereto or inconsistent therewith contained in any Letters Patent, Order, direction or other law relating to the use of seals by High Courts.
1100121 3[ Repeal of Ordinance 13 of 1950.] Rep. by the Repealing and Amending Act, 1957 (36 of 1957), s. 2 and Sch. I.
999999 1Subs. by the Adaptation of Laws (No. 3) Order, 1956, for" Part A State or Part B State".
2Subs., ibid., for" Part C State".
3The word and letter" Part A" omitted, ibid.
4Subs., ibid., for" name of the State".
